de.lmu.dbs.jfeaturelib.features

Class PHOG

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.dbs.jfeaturelib.features.AbstractFeatureDescriptor
      • de.lmu.dbs.jfeaturelib.features.PHOG
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Descriptor, FeatureDescriptor

    public class PHOG
extends AbstractFeatureDescriptor
    Generates Pyramid Histograms of Oriented Gradients (PHoG). Phogs were first introduced in "Representing shape with a spatial pyramid kernel" (2007). By Anna Bosch, Andrew Zisserman, Xavier Munoz See also http://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/publications/2007/Bosch07/ and http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1282340 for further information. In the original paper, canny edge extraction is applied prior to extracting the gradients. As edge detection can be performed in several ways, it is not hard wired. It can be enabled in the properties by setting features.phog.canny to true. The parameters for the canny operator are also taken from the properties file. If another edge detection operator should be used, simple set the canny parameter to false and call run(ij.process.ImageProcessor) with an pre processed image.
    Since:
    11/4/2011

      • run

        public void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Description copied from interface: Descriptor
        Start processing of this algorithm on the given image processor. Keep in mind that if the imageProcessor is changed, Supports.NoChanges must not be set. This is also the case even if only ImageProcessor.snapshot() is used.

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Description copied from interface: FeatureDescriptor
        Returns a short plain Text description about the Descriptor and the semantics of the double array obtained from FeatureDescriptor.getFeatures(). May return null if no description is implemented - even though this should be avoided by any means.
